  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED FOR SPILL. IRREG CHUTE/SLIDE IRREG PACKAGE FELL ONTO THE FLOOR. USING BOOTS, APRON, GOGGLE AND GLOVES) ON AND SPILL CART, RESPONDER WENT TO RESPOND TO THE SPILL. USING DECISION TREE AND RESPONDSE SHEET. RESPONDER USED ZEPZORBENT AND CONTAINERIZED THE SPILL INTO THE SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR PROCESSING.

  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE TO FIND METAL CONTAINING ON THE FLOOR OF TRAINER LEAKING AND ANOTHER PACKAGE NEXT TO IT LEAKED UPON. RESPONDER THEN PROCEEDED TO CLEAN UP SPILL, PLACE DAMAGED CONTAINER INTO SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER LOADED SPILL TRAY AND OTHER DAMAGED PACKAGE ONTO SPILL CART TO RETURN TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024030142
item.description:
Report X-2024030142

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-04
  • City: KENAI
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A PACKAGE FROM OREGON TO ALASKA MARKED AS CONTAINING CELLULAR ACCESSORIES WAS OUT FOR DELIVERY IN KENAI. THE DRIVER PICKED UP THE BOX AND CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE SPILLED TO THE TRUCK FLOOR. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE UPS FACILITY AND INSPECTION REVEALED VARIOUS CELLULAR ACCESSORIES ALONG WITH EIGHT ACOUSTIX TRUE WIRELESS AUDIOBUDS + WITH CHARGING CASE INCLUDED. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM ONT TO ANC AND ANC TO ENA.

THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IN THE USA IS 1Z7R65991305109470. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THESE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED FROM NEW YORK USING UPS ACCOUNT 7R6599, GOLDBELLY, 127 W 26TH ST., SUITE 1000, NEW YORK NY 10001.

item.title: Report X-2024030143
item.description:
Report X-2024030143

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A WET PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH AND HAD A SMALL AMOUNT OF DRY ICE VAPOR COMING FROM THE BOTTOM CORNER OF THE BOX. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 40 LBS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING TWO BIOHAZARD BAGS CONTAINING SPECIMENS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. THERE IS A RUSH, PERISHABLE INSULATED STICKER AFFIXED TO ONE SIDE OF THE BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MARYLAND USING THE CONSIGNEE UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 442F01, AXIS CLINICALS, 1711 CENTER AVE W, DILWORTH MN 56529-1342.

item.title: Report E-2024030158
item.description:
Report E-2024030158

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: SAPULPA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LTU experienced a battery acid release from a 1750-pound UN2794 battery. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 20’ area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading/pallet failure. Absorbents and soda ash were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted area. The battery was up righted and re-secured for shipment on. All impacted absorbents, pallet wood, and PPE were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: WEARING PROPER PPE, RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE ROLLER LINE. BOX WAS WET ON BOTTOM CORNER NO LIQUID ON THE ROLLER LINE OR ON FLOOR. NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. item.title: Report E-2024030155
item.description:
Report E-2024030155

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN3082 Mesotrione 40% SC release from a 135-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 15’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a puncture caused by other freight during dock operations. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents, pads, and PPE into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024030147
item.description:
Report E-2024030147

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN2522 Visiomer Madame release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 12-ounces of product released to a 2’ x 6” area of the metal drum lid/body. The release was due to the drum having the incorrect bung cap placed on it. The bung was replaced with a new one and secured for shipment on. The impacted drums were wiped down with absorbent pads which were then containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: MILAN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding a leaking metal drum containing hazardous product, DK 190 RL. The drum was leaking from the lid that would not properly secure. A Contractor cleaned-up the spilled product and attempted to secure the lid to stop the release. After several failed attempts, it was decided to overpack the drum and dispose of as waste. Additionally, one drain containing impacted oil dry and PPE was generated as waste, as well. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the spill.

item.description:
Report X-2024030126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CONTENTS OF AN AIR PACKAGE SHIPPED FROM COLOMBIA TO THE USA WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A STRONG ACETONE ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS, ONE CONTAINER OF LUMELI REMOVEDOR DE ESMALTE TRANSLATED AS LUMELI NAIL POLISH REMOVER WAS FOUND LEAKING. THE LEAK WAS CONTAINED WITHIN THE PACKAGE WITH JUST A SMALL STAIN ON THE OUTER PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN PREVIOUSLY INSPECTED BY CUSTOMS OFFICIALS IN MIAMI PRIOR TO BEING RELEASED INTO THE UPS NETWORK. THERE IS "OPENED FOR CUSTOMS PURPOSES" TAPE SURROUNDING THE PACKAGE AND SURROUNDING THE LUMELI NAIL POLISH REMOVER INSIDE THE BOX. THE PACKAGE SCANS IN THE UPS NETWORK AS UPS SMALL PACKAGE TRACKING 1ZB6864V0423811919 BUT ALL THERMAL TRACKING LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGE SHOW COLOMBIA NATIONAL POSTAL SERVICE, 4-72, TRACKING NUMBER CP0051323737CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM COLOMBIA USING UPS ACCOUNT B6864V, ANICAM COLOMBIA SAS, TV 93 #53-32 BODEGA 13, PARQUE EMPRESARIAL EL DORADO, BOGOTA DC 110911 COLOMBIA.

  • Description: On February 27, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. Personnel placed the damaged drum into one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum, and they deployed granular absorbents to the released product and swept them in with hand tools. One (1) 55-gallon drum of spent absorbents, PPE, and any cleanup debris was staged in the terminal's waste holding room along with the 85-gallon salvage drum that contained the damaged drum. All undamaged freight was staged on the dock for further handling by R+L personnel.

  • City: RICHMOND

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/14/2024 at 1812, personnel in the CSXT Acca Yard reported UTLX 210839, a loaded tank car of Alcohols N.O.S., was suspected to be leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Valero Marketing, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report # 2024-02-14-00201). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, and Blaise MacDonald, a CSXT hazardous materials manager, were dispatched to the scene and found the manway cover was mis-aligned allowing the release; additionally, seven out of eight manway cover bolts were less than tool tight. Response personnel inspected the manway cover gasket and properly secured the manway cover for transportation. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Judy Watson 210-934-8157).

  • Description: Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by RDX personnel in Williston, FL regarding the assistance with a (1) gallon spill of Sectagon K54 (UN3266,8,PG II). The product was released from a poly tote onto the trailer floor at a terminal. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of Sectagon K54. Contractors were able to clean and neutralize the release with ABZORBIT PREMIUM ABSORBENT and the proper PPE. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55- gallon poly drum which was taken off-site for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030137
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: CHICKASHA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COFFEYVILLE RESOUCES CRUDE TRANSPORTATION, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The transport was headed West on HWY 39 when the driver turned to enter the Enable Naples unload station, Crude Oil began to spill along side the trailer. The transport stopped and proceeded to call his supervisor. When the supervisor arrived, along with internal environmental personnel it was determined that driver was responsible for the spill. The driver did admit he had failed to close the fire valve and vent line valve on his trailer. The environmental clean up crew and local authorities were alerted. The environmental crew arrived at 7:53am. They spread powder absorbent on the highway and used a street sweeper to cleanup the residue. No waste was generated and no manifest produced for disposal. Work was completed at 8:33am. There was a local sheriff vehicle at the intersection at 5am but they left as soon as CRCT personnel arrived. No other authorities from Grady County were ever on site.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the dock floor, trailer interior and asphalt and swept them in with hand tools. The residual product within the punctured tote was emptied and transferred to a new 330-gallon tote. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO THE DMP AND UPON INSPECTION OF PACKAGE WAS DESCOVERED TO BE AN UNDECLARED CLASS 8 CORROSIVE. PACKAGE HAD ALL DIAMOND LABELS FULLY COVERED WITH DUCT TAPE.   • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5-gallons of UN2672 Ammonium Hydroxide (10-35%) released from a 5-gallon poly jug due to a forklift puncture impacting a 1'X5' area of the trailer floor. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. Absorbents were applied in the trailer and swept up. Soda Ash solution was used to neutralize the impacted area. Impacted absorbents, PPE and the empty jug were containerized and overpacked into one 55-gallon poly drum of waste and staged in terminal OS&D for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030135
item.description:
Report E-2024030135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: DAVENPORT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was stopping at the end of his day and was completing the Post-trip inspection when noticed liquids drippings from trailer onto his tire at 1800. The driver grabed some absorbent to contain the liquid and called our emergency response at 1806. A team was dispatched out to address the release 1830. The crew arrived on scene at around 1900 and added more absorbents to provide a containment and monitoring. Equipment was need to gain access to the containers as the trailer was double stacked and full. The equipment was on scene by 0700 and unloading began. The container was reached by 0900 and found that there was a small dent in the bottom chime which a small hole was found. The material was cleaned up using absorbent pads and was disposed of per the proper requirements. The trailer was then reloaded and secured by around 1700 and driver was sent on his way.

item.title: Report X-2024030101
item.description:
Report X-2024030101

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS CONSUMER COMMODITY ID8000 WITH A CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL, AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING, AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY IN THE NETHERLANDS. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE PRODUCT LEAKING DUE TO THE CLOSURE BEING PRESSED DOWN BY OTHER PRODUCTS WITHIN THE PACKAGE. SOME ABSORBENT LINING WAS INSIDE THE PACKAGE WHICH HELPED CONTROL THE EXTENT OF LEAK OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE AND CONTENTS HAVE BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE NORMAL DISPOSAL PROCEDURES. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE NETHERLANDS GOING TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B567JO, ARVATO BENELUX BV, BREM 1, HEIJEN NETHERLANDS 6598MH.

item.title: Report X-2024030092
item.description:
Report X-2024030092

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER SAW THIS PACKAGE ON A YELLOW PALLET UNDERNEATH THE EXTENDO OF DOOR 35. PACKAGE WAS VISIBLE WET AND STAINED. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION RESPONDER NOTICED IT WAS A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. RESPONDER BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATING AND PROCESSING. WHEN RESPONDER OPENED UP THE BOX, RESPONDER COULD SEE THAT ALL THE BOTTLES HAD LEAKED. SINCE ALL THE BOTTLES WERE LEAKING, THEY WERE PROCESSED INTO THE DMP AS THEY CANNOT BE RETURNED IN A SALAVGE DRUM.

  • Description: RESPONDER WAS INFORMED OF A POTENTIAL HAZMAT LEAKER ON THE UNLOAD IRREG BELT. ARRIVING RESPONDER WAS POINTED TOWARDS SEVERAL HAZMAT PACKAGES ON THE BELT AND WAS TOLD THERE WAS A STRONG CHEMICAL ODOR COMING FROM ONE OF THE PACKAGES. SORTING THROUGH THE PACKAGES RESPONDER FOUND THIS HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT HAD A STRONG ODOR COMING FROM IT. OPENING THE PACKAGE FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND UPON FORTHER INSPECTION FOUND ONE OF THE CAPS TO BE EXTREMELY LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED SOME OF THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT AND WET THE INTERNAL CARDBOARD LAYER.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING AT 19:20 ON THE HVD OF THE PD-1 BELT IN THE EARTH CITY, MO UPS HUB. THE SPILLAGE WAS CLEANED, CONTAINED, AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. AN EXTERNAL INSPECTION SHOWED DENTED CORNERS. THE INTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED NO PACKING MATERIAL TO PROTECT THE INNER RECEPTICLES (1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES) FROM THE SHIPPING PROCESS. ONE BOTTLE HAD A CRACKED CAP. ALL MATERIAL HAS BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE UPS DAMAGED MATERIALS PROGRAM.

item.title: Report X-2024030076
item.description:
Report X-2024030076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-24
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY A CLERK IN SMALL SORT WHO DETECTED A STRONG ODOR EMANATING FROM THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP FLOOR AND GIVEN TO A RESPONDER. UPON INSPECTION THE PACKAGE DID NOT HAVE ANY PHYSICAL SIGNS OF LEAKAGE BUT DID IN FACT SMELL STRONGLY OF SOLVENT. HAZMAT LABELLING ON THE PACKAGE FURTHER INDICATED THE PRODUCT INSIDE HAD BEEN COMPROMISED AND NEEDED TO BE CONTAINED IMMEDIATELY. PACKAGE WAS OPENED AND THE PRODUCT WAS CLEARLY HEAVILY SOILED FROM INTERNAL LEAKAGE, WHICH WAS MOSTLY CONTAINED VIA PLASTIC WRAPPING OVER PRODUCT, HOWEVER VAPOR WAS ESCAPING. PRODUCT WAS IMMEDIATELY BAGGED WITH LIQUIDS PRESENT TO PREVENT FURTHER VAPOR RELEASE.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in hazmat bag and bin then placed in Hazmat drum.

  • Description: 1. X-2024021663 During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans with positive closure rings, with bubble wrap for dunnage and inside of plastic bags. One of the two cans had a damaged bottom chime causing a spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and anew declaration will be obtained for movement. 2. X-2024021919 During sort operations at the MEMH facility a fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered. The fiberboard box contained three metal cans. The cans were all packaged with closure rings and inside of plastic bags. The ring and lid on one of the cans was not sealed causing the spill inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024030007
item.description:
Report E-2024030007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-07T15:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: Saint CLAIRSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERIGAS PROPANE, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver of bobtail truck meets oncoming dump truck on narrow roadway and moves slightly to the right side to avoid striking mirrors. The rear tires of the bobtail truck leave the edge of the roadway and pulls the truck into the berm. Immediately after the oncoming truck passes the bobtail driver corrects his line of travel back up on the road surface. and crosses the left lane, out of control, and leaves the pavement into the ditch, striking a group of trees. During the impact, a section of piping for propane vapor on the rear of the bobtail is sheared off, resulting in a propane release. The driver was able to slow the leak at the cargo tank within 5 minutes by reseating the excess flow valve where the piping had been sheared off. A secondary bobtail truck responded to the scene and was able to safely empty the damaged bobtail by transferring the propane into the secondary truck. The damaged bobtail was towed to an impound lot that evening. The remaining propane vapor in the cargo tank was flared off the following day.

  • Description: A THREE DAY SELECT AIR PACKAGE WAS OBSERVED WITH FROST BUILDUP ON THE OUTSIDE AND WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX IS A PREPRINTED ZEP CONCENTRATED ALL-PURPOSE CLEANER BOX WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS AND "PROTECT FROM FREEZING NOT FOR AIR TRANSPORT" PREPRINTED ON THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER INSPECTED CONTENTS TO FIND LESS THAN APPOXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING PET FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT 98568E, KHARTUNERZ, 41421 DATE ST, SUITE 108, MURRIETA CA 92562.

Once discovered we promptly cleaned the material up and placed it in a proper setup to be brought back to the Hazardous cage to be processed. DescribePack: Inside the box there is a plastic pail. On the bottle of the plastic pail, it opened. The whole entire bottom of the Plastic pail is falling off and it is leaking all of its powder. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a hazardous bag alongside a proper red tote to contain all the release. What released was swept up and placed in the proper bag/tote as well. 2. X-2024021782 SequenceEvent: Package was found at the power turn where we process NCs. Package was discovered and quickly cleaned up and placed in a hazmat bag and also in a red tote to be processed in our hazmat cage. DescribePack: The package has failure in the plastic pail inside the Box. It is cracked heavily at the bottom and is leaking a lot of its inner contents inside of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a hazmat bag to catch all of the powder that is releasing from the plastic pail. The contents that leaked was also placed in the hazmat bag.

  • Description: When trailer was cleaned the tankwash missed putting a gasket in the discharge cap. Ecolab loaded the trailer and there was some product between the internal and external valves. The external valve wasn't tightened down well enough allowing product to get to the discharge cap. The discharge cap was missing the gasket inside which allowed the product to leak out on the ground. A response team was called in for clean up.

  • Description: On 2/7/2024 at approximately 1830, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4678718 at the ramp facility in Chicago, reporting a corrosive spill. The shipment consisted of 58 plastic jerricans, one of which showed evidence of spillage. Further investigation revealed that the jerrican in question had a loose closure, confirming spillage. The package was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package had been improperly loaded into the trailer which caused the spill incident to occur by the packing becoming crushed. Once it was discovered, action was taken to isolate the scene from package handlers and to contain all damaged packages affected, including the culprit package within the hazmat processing area for further investigation and processing. DescribePack: Package had been poorly loaded into the trailer by the previous station, that the package had become crushed from the weight of the packages on top of it. One bottle had been crushed enough to be punctured and leak. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Effort was taken to mitigate the release effects by containing the damaged boxes and culprit hazmat in hazmat bags and totes and neutralizing the spill with an absorbent spill aid.

DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: All lose caps were tightened and contents were placed in lined salvage drum to prevent further damages.

THE CONTAINER LEAKED DUE TO HAVING A POOR SEAL AROUND THE TOP FROM A WARPED LID. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR SERVICE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT 0VE277, SN CONSOLIDATION, 193 LAUREL FOREST CIRCLE, ATLANTA GA 30342.

  • Description: X-2024021589: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN HONOLULU, HAWAII, CONTENTS OF ONE BLACK HEAVY PLASTIC BAG WAS INSPECTED. ONE INNER BOX WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING WAS FOUND INSIDE THE BAG. INSPECTION OF THIS INNER BOX REVEALED TWO AEROSOL CANS OF CVS SPORT 50 CLEAR SPRAY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST BAG CONTAINING THE LTD QTY MARKED BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. X-2024021906: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN HONOLULU, HAWAII, CONTENTS OF ONE BLACK HEAVY PLASTIC BAG OFFERED AIR SERVICE TO UPS WERE INSPECTED. ONE INNER BOX WITH A GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING WAS FOUND INSIDE THE BAG. INSPECTION OF THIS INNER BOX REVEALED TWO BIOFREEZE GEL PAIN RELIEVERS AND ONE BIOFREEZE ROLL ON TOPICAL PAIN RELIEVER. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST BAG CONTAINING THE LTD QTY MARKED BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came down belt appearing undamaged, but appeared to begin leaking slightly from corners of box after being scanned to truck. Package was isolated from sort and QA called to inspect. Package was then found to be an unlabeled and damaged hazmat. DescribePack: Outer package appears fully undamaged, with no tears/punctures/abrasions, but is leaking paint from corners and edges. 1 item in package is dented, likely via weight of other item inside; outer packaging appears sufficient for items within, but inner packaging and blocking is inadequate. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When damage was first suspected, package was removed from the van line and placed into a black non-hazmat bin lined with a plain plastic bag liner. Leak only escaped package after it was brought to van line to be loaded, so was mostly contained within box. Upon inspection, package was found to contain 2 hazmat items, and was moved to a red hazmat bin with plastic hazmat bag liner.

  • Description: It was reported that approximately 10-gallons of ENILEX NI-5A Corrosive Liquid, n.o.s (UN1760, 8, III) released from (2) 5-gallon pails. The release was caused by a puncture from a pallet due to a load shift. The release impacted a 53’ x 3’ area of the trailer floor, the side of the trailer, and a 60’ x 1’ area of asphalt. E3 Environmental was able to neutralize and clean the release with absorbents, and the proper PPE. The remaining cargo was shrink wrapped, restacked, and secured for transit along with the overpack. All waste was containerized in (3) 55-gallon poly drums, which was then taken offsite by the E3 Environmental for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030011
item.description:
Report E-2024030011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 29, 2024, at 0645 ET, XPO Logistics Terminal USB experienced a release of UN1866 “Orthophthalic Resin” from a 55-gallon metal drum. On February 29, 2024, at 0714 ET, XPO Logistics retained Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) to complete all regulatory reporting. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct all on site cleanup activities. On February 29, 2024, at 0920 EST, contractors arrived on site. They confirmed approximately 1-gallon of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a pallet nail puncture. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and the impacted pallet wood were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was then staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024021321
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-05T15:11:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/6/2024 at approximately 2200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 750823 at the ramp facility in Atlanta reporting a dangerous goods spill. The package consisted of 4 plastic bottles inside of a fiberboard box, one of which had a loose cap, resulting in spillage. The spillage was contained, and the shipment was placed in a salvage drum. The shipment awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an area of the concrete floor and estimated that one (1) cup of material was released due to one (1) 270-gallon damaged poly tote. First Call Environmental personnel transferred the remaining product to a new poly tote and shredded the damaged poly tote and containerized it into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called out for an Admin's assistance in containing the shipment. DescribePack: The metal pail is badly dented, and there appears to be a small puncture mark within the denting. The leaked contents came from that puncture mark. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the shipment in a hazardous materials spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as the liquid started to appear on the floor cardboard and absorbent were placed down. The container was immediately placed inside a salvage drum.
